ELEPHANTA CAVES

Aksa beach is one of those beaches in Mumbai with clean sand and less crowd. There are couple of vendors selling ice candies and some snacks. \n\nDue to its unsafe nature and distance in far suburb this beach is less explored by tourists.

Madh/Marve beach. 
Essel World and Water Kingdom. 
National Park (Borivali). 
Inorbit and Infinity malls at Malad Link road.

Aksa has those sweet moments for people who want to spend sometime in peace and with nature but also within city. 

The shades of coconut trees are blessing in summer, There are resorts near the beach which you can enjoy as well. The view of sunset is breath taking near the sea. 

Aksa village has small huts which are converted to resturants and hotels, and one can relax and have snacks there.
The best time to visit Aksa beach is between the months September and April.

This beach is known to be one of the most visited beaches in India and is situated in Ville Parle in Western suburbs of Mumbai. 

 Juhu beach is also famous amongst Indians for its street food and local delicacies. 

Watching the sunset in this wonderful place, guarded by the vast Arabian sea provides a beautiful visual for the eyes.
Versova is a nearby attraction from Juhu

The Street foods such as "Bhel puri" ,"Pani puri" and "Pav Bhaji" are mouth watering delicacies one must try. 

One can also taste cuisines from around the world as well as try local sea food near Juhu Beach. 

Young and adventerous ones can try activities like horse riding and camel rides.
The best time to visit Juhu beach is from months of October to February. \nIt is best to avoid visiting this beach during monsoon season because there can be possibilities of high tides.

Dadar Chowpatty beach is a small and less crowded rocky beach with little sand around. People come here to enjoy silence,breeze,sunset view and the giant view of Bandra Worli sea Link Bridge. 

Dadar beach is scenic with couple of attractions frequently visited by locals, walkable distance from shivaji park. 

An awesome view of Bandra Worli sea Link accompanies you along with the sounds and breezes of the ocean
Bandra Worli Sea Link. \nDadar Market,near station. \nYou can visit Siddhivinayak temple from there.
One can have view of Bandra worli sea link. \nIn north side of beach some refreshment can be found. \nWalkable distance to Shivaji park, where locals frequent.
The best time to visit Dadar Chowpatty is between the months of September and April.

Dadar Chowpatty beach is a small and less crowded rocky beach with little sand around. People come here to enjoy silence,breeze,sunset view and the giant view of Bandra Worli sea Link Bridge. 

Dadar beach is scenic with couple of attractions frequently visited by locals, walkable distance from shivaji park. 

An awesome view of Bandra Worli sea Link accompanies you along with the sounds and breezes of the ocean
Bandra Worli Sea Link. \nDadar Market,near station. \nYou can visit Siddhivinayak temple from there.
One can have view of Bandra worli sea link. \nIn north side of beach some refreshment can be found. \nWalkable distance to Shivaji park, where locals frequent.
he best time to visit Dadar Chowpatty is between the months of September and April.

The beautiful beach is actually made of cluster of little villages and farmlands situated in the North western coast of Mumbai. 

The shore is surrounded by mangroves which not only add to its scenic beauty,but also seperates the beach from the mainland. 

The Madh Island beach attracts large crowds due to its calm waters and soothing scenery. 

This beach is one of the cleanet one in the state.

Madh Fort. 

Erangal 

St Bonaventuren

The Madh island beach is popular venue for shooting movies and Daily local soaps. It is a different experience to watch a live shoot. 

"The Retreat" and "The Resort" are the two popular five star hotels near the beach.Tourists can spend time enjoying the magnificent view along side the swimming pool of the resort and pamper themselves a little. 

There is music being played on the beach for people to enjoy. 

People can explore local fishing communities that are situated close to the seashore.
Best time to visit this beach is between October and June.At this time of the year there is less humidity and the weather is pleasend.

Marve beach is located in the Western Suburbs of Malad in Mumbai. 

Ferry Services to Essel World and Water kingdom theme parks and Manori are available from here. 

Marve beach can be reached from Malad railway station, Rickshaws and taxis. 

The beach is not safe for swimming due to its sinking sand.
Essel World theme park. Gorai Beach:The gorai beach is popular for its beautiful surroundings and villas.Ferries are available at Marve beach to gorai beach.

One will love to explore the sheer scenic beauty of these beaches in the absesnce of the chaotic crowd of vendors. 
\The beach has some very fine cottages built on the sea shore with a beautiful view of the arabian sea. 

These cottages offer utmost luxury and hospitablity and luxury and are definetely tempting for most that see them.
The Best time to visit this beach is from October to March, as there is less humidity. This beach is near from the residential area and ideal for a morning run or a morning walk.

Essel World is the biggest and one of the first amusment parks in India. 

This amusment park is popular for its colossal infrastructure and several exciting dry and wet rides. 

The best feature of the Essel World Amusment park is that it is open all year round.

There are several high adrenaline fun rides catering to various age groups. Dry rides,Wet rides, a discotheque and a massive food court are some of the many attractions of this park. 

Among all fun activities that can be enjoyed, the ice skating ring,discotheque and bowling alley serve as the prime attractions for people. 

There are also avenues for shopping and food courts for people looking for a holistic experience.
11 am to 7 pm on Weekdays. \n10 am to 7 pm on Weekends.
390 Rupees to 490 Rupees for Children. \n590 Rupees to 790 Rupees for Adults. \n290 Rupees for Senior citizens.
The best time to visit Essel World is from October to March.

Water Kingdom is known to be Asia's biggest water theme park and was established in 1998. 

Located in Gorai,Mumbai,the water park is an extension of Essel World. 

Apart from the slides ,rides and other fun activities, the water park also has a number of restaurants that promise tourists lip-smacking delights. 

Water Kingdom is truly a remarkable place that offers unlimited fun for all who visit the park.

"Aquadrome" is a unique feature at the Water Kingdom,where a dance zone of 7000 square feet is set with numerous water sprinklers. 

Tourists can enjoy dancing to the music while being occasionally sprayed with water from the sprinklers. 

The "Misphisly Hill" has 12 terrifying high adrenaline rides that are extremely popular at the water park. 

The "Drifting River" is a loop of gently flowing water that promises a ton of excitement with slow currents, where people can relax and float. 

Some of the other enthralling attractions here include the "juicy jammer","Turbi Terminator","Black Demon" and "Lemon Drops".
11 am to 7 pm on Weekdays \n11 am to 7 pm on Weekends
590 Rupees for Children. \n890 Rupees for Adults. \n290 Rupees for Senior citizens.
One can visit Water Kingdom throughout the year.

Adlabs Imagica is India's first and only International Standard Theme park offering fun, action, entertainment, dining, shopping at a single location. 

Imagica is driven by whole world of fantastical themes to bring Indian families experiences that they have never had befrore 

In every zone you will be immersed in a new theme that will extend through every touch point. 

With 26 attractions and rides and 5 themed restaurants,Imagica is a place where stories come alive.

Thrill Rides 
Famile Rides 
Kiddie Rides 
Themed Attractions
11 am to 8 pm on Weekdays \n11 am to 9 pm on Weekends

Weekdays 
1200 Rupees for Children. 
1500 Rupees for Adults. 
1200 Rupees for Senior citizens. 

Weekends and Holidays 
1600 Rupees for Children. 
1900 Rupees for Adults. 
1600 Rupees for Senior citizens.
The theme park can be visited all year around.

Suraj water park is an exciting water recreation paradise guranteeing an enthralling adventure for all those who visit the park. 

One can also find a massive figure of Lord Shiva with river ganga flowing from his mane. 

Suraj water park is indeed a perfect destination to relax and connect with nature. 

The water park is a five time Limca Book of Record Holder and is a winner of international as well as national awards.

"Nanha tal" is a little slide for children and offers a great deal of excitement. 

Other fascinating slides like "Ding Dong", "Lakbak and Zabak" and "Sing-a-Song" are star attractions of Suraj Water park. 

The "Crazy River" and "Lazy River" are water areas that emulate the flow of real rivers, where children and adults are pulled by the current, using floats and rubber tubes as protection against the water.
10 am to 6 pm Weekdays and Weekends

Weekdays 
500 Rupees for Children. 
650 Rupees for Adults. 

Weekends 
600 Rupees for Children. 
800 Rupees for Adults.
One can visit Suraj water park all year round.

The Haji Ali Dargah is a historical landmarik in Mumbai, and is also one of the most prestigous Islamic symbols situated in South Mumbai. 

The Haji Ali was built by a wealthy Muslim merchant who became a saint named Haji Ali Shah Bukhari. 

People from all over the world visit the Haji Ali Dargah irrespective of their case ,religion or creed. 

The Haji Ali Dargah is popular pilgrimage site today and most of the tourist visit the tomb of Pir Haji Ali Shah Bukhari to seek blessings for Wealth,Health, marriage etc 

The Haji Ali Dargah is made of "Makrana" marble that Emperor Shah Jahan used to build the Taj Mahal. 

The Haji Ali Dargah houses two important monuments-tomb of Pir Haji Ali Bukhari and a mosque.
5.30 am to 10 pm Weekdays and Weekends
No entry Fee

Apart from visiting the Dargah ,offering prayers and seeking blessings of the saint, there are various other things to do in and around the Dargah. 

Local stalls outside the comples of Haji Ali Dargah will give you the opportunity to indulge in some delicous local cuisines and local specialities such as Kebabs, Chaat,Ice cream,Mughlai Biryani etc. 

If you are an avid shopper the best places would be crawford market and fashion street. 

If you enjoy serenity and happen to be a nature lover, you can decide to unwing at the beach at Mahim Bay.

Worli Sea Link 
Breach Candy 
Nana Chowk 
Mahalakshmi Race Course stadium

Mahalaxmi Temple is an ancient temple dedicated to honor "Godess Mahalaxmi" who is also known as the "Godess of Wealth". 

A large number of believers throng this temple on Fridays. 

During the days of Navratri's festival thousands of devotees flock this shrine to witness the celebrations. 

Idol of Godess Mahalaxmi is decorated elegantly with gold bangles,pearl necklaces,nose studs and flowers etc. 

One can find the three idols of Godess Mahalaxmi ,Godess Mahakali and Godess Saraswati places inside the Mahalaxmi Temple.
6 am to 10 pm Weekdays and Weekends
No entry Fee

One can visit the Mahalaxmi Temple during Navratri to witness the glorious destive celebrations. 

Devotees can offer coconuts,sweets,flowers etc to honor the Godess during this hold ocassion. 

One can also shop here as there are plenty of stalls selling flowers,sweets and religious relics withing the temple complex.

The Atria Mall located in Worli is very close to Mahalaxmi temple and is an amazing place to visit, especially if you love Shopping. 

The Heera Panna Shopping Center is one of the most popular shopping areas in Mumbai and is sited close to the temple. 

One can also visit the Haji Ali Dargah which is another popular tourist destination.

Mount Mary Church is Roman Catholic Church, dedicated to Virgin Mary,situated in Mumbai. 

What makes this church more beautiful is that it is sited on top of a hill known as Sunderban Bandra which overlooks the mighty Arabian sea 

It is believed that the church has unbelievable healing powers and for this reason, the church is herded by devotees every day. 

The Bandra Fair or the "Feast of Mount Mary" is a week long celebration held every September at the Mound Mary church.

Monday to Saturday 
6 am to 1 pm 
2 pm to 8 pm 

Sunday 
6 am to 8 pm
No entry Fee

The week of the "Bandra Fair" or the "Feast of Mount Mary", which is held in September ,is a perfect time to visit Mount Mary Church as it is completely decorated. 

One can shop for religous artifacts innovatively shaped candles,wax figures of virgin mary or even buy Goan sweets from various stalls outside the church. 

One can get a spectacular view of sunsets from this church.

"Father Agnel" is another church sited on Carter Road, close to Mount Mary Church. 

The famous Jogger's park is also situated in Bandra and is a must visit for all tourists. 

You can also explore Linking road, which is perfect flea market for shopping.

International Society for Krishna Conciousness, also popularly known as the Hare Krishna movement is a spritual society founded by his Divine Grace A.C Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada in July 1966 in New York. 

This temple, also known as the "Hare Rama Hare Krishna temple" and "Radha Rasabihariji" is dedicated to Lord Krishna" and was built by the ISKON Foundation. 

The temple is embellished with various paintings and statues within its interiors, making the temple look all the more mesmerizing. 

The temple is an apt spot for meditation and prayers especially for the people who seek to increase ones spritiual knowledge and add on to their intellectual development. 

The aim of ISKON is to acquiant all people of world with universal principles of self-realization and good conciousness so that they may derive the highest benefit of spritiual understanding ,unity and peace.

"Darshans"(prayers) timings are as follows 

4.30 am Mangala Aarti. 
5.30 am Tulsi puja. 
7.15 am Sringar darshan 
7.30 am Guru puja 
8.00 am Bhagavatam discourse 
0.30 pm Raj Bhoga Aarti 
4.30 pm Usthapana Aarti 
7.00 pm Sahdhya Aarti 
7.30 pm Bhagvad gita discourse 
8.30 pm Shayana Aarti 

Temple will be closed between 
1.00 pm to 4.30 pm 
9.00 pm to 4.30 am
No entry Fee

Attend the various temple activities chant hymns and meditate. 

One can witness and be part of the revelries,chanting the "Mahamantra" inside the temple.Apart from this the temple conducts prayers,"bhajans" every evening. 

Participate in various spritual, cultural and learning activities. These activities are held within the temple and one can either observe or participate in those activities and get knowledge about the vedas. 

Enjoying celebrations and festive activities during "Janmashtami" which is an important day at ISKON temple.
Juhu Beach is right next to the temple and is a perfect get away from the busy city life. \nChowpatty Beach

Siddhivinayan Temple is a standing testament of beauty and architecture. 

This ancient temple was constructed in 1801 and is dedicated to the elephant=head deity of Hinduism,"Lord Ganesh". 

Tuesday is considered to be the most important day for "Puja" and "Darshan" at this temple. 

When one visits this place, one cannot help but admire the temple's ancient style of architecture and its many features. 

The idol of Lord Ganesha is sculpted from a single black stone. 

An elegant masterpiece with a unique design, the Siddhivinayak Temple is a hotspot for tourists who visit Mumbai.
5.30 am to 10 pm Weekdays and Weekends
No Entry Fee

Phool Gali is a street filled with various stalls that leads towards Siddhivinayak Temple. 

The shopkeepers on this street sell fresh flowers, sweets,coconuts and many other "puja" accessories which one can buy on their way to the temple for offering to the lord. 

As Tuesday is considered to be a special day for Lord Ganesh devotees,"Aartis" are performed inside the temple which is flocked by devout worshippers. 

During "Sankashti Chaturthi" and "Angaraki" , a large number of devotees gather to attend the special events held within this temple.
Worli sea Link \nShivaji Park

The magnificent golden Global Pagoda is the highlight at one of the Top 5 Vipassana Meditation centers in India. 

Its the world's largest stone dome built without any supporting pillars. 

The dome is approximately 29 meters high, twice the size of previously largest monument of its kind in Bijapur,India. 

There's also an art gallery showing the life and teachings of lord Buddha.
9 am to 7 pm Weekdays and Weekends
No entry Fee

One can visit Painting Gallery which depicts stories of people benefitted from Vipassana practive in Buddhas time. 

Visit the Buddha Statue to honor Buddha as a great spritual scientish who taught Vipassana and nature based teachings for benefit of Humanity. 

One can also visit the food court for refreshment needs and visitors and Burmese Murals for Culture and art enthusiast to learn about Burmese customs.
Essel World \nGorai Beach

Elephanta caves lie just off the coast of the Arabian Sea, situated at a 10 km radius from the bustling metropolis. 

Elephanta Caves are perfect expression of archaic indian art associated to the cult of Lord Shiva. 

The island on which the caves are built was originally known as Gharapuri, and the Portugese retitled it as ELphanta Island when they discovered a large stone structure of an elephant on the Island. 

The temple was primarily built for the worship of Lord Shiva and "Shivaism". 

The Elephanta island is a quiet and picturesque island with green foilage and harmless primates scanpering about.
9 am to 5 pm Tuesday to Sunday \n Monday closed
10 Rupees per person (Indian) \n250 Rupees per person (Non Indian)

A paradise for women, this little market offers sculptures made of marble, jewellery, clothes ,paintings and many other local arts and wood work. 

If you are interested in locan indian Food, an MTDC run resort offers a find spread at a reasonable cost. 

One can also enjoy the scenic beauty of this Island.
Gateway of India

The Hanging Gardens id dedicated to its barrister Pherozesha Mehta,which is why these gardens are also known as pherozesha Mehta Garden. 

This reknowned garden located on the Malbar Hill is known for its splendig green vegetation and animal shaped hedges, which is an interesting sight for anyone who visits this spot. 

Adding to the garden's beauty is the comforting view of the vash Arabian sea. 

Watching the sunset from the Hanging gardens would provide you with an experience worth remembering. 

The striking flower, clock situated in the center of the garden, serves as the main attraction for all tourists.

One can spend an entire day exploring the natural beauty of these terraced gardens. 

You can also watch a glorious sunset from these gardens. 

If photography is your hobby,then Hanging gardens is the best place for you to make use of your creative photography skills. 

Hanging Gardent is the perfect place for early morning jogs and yoga.
5 am to 9 pm Weekdays and Weekends
No entry fee
Its open throughout the year, and can be visited anytime of the year

Situated on top of the Mumbai's Malbar Hill, this park is named after Jawarlal Nehru's wife, Kamala Nehru. 

From this garden, one can enjoy the spectacular sight of the Chowpatty Beach and also Marine Drive(Queen's Necklace)/ 

Kamala Nehru Park is a show shaped structure ,with widespread lush greenery.

People come here to enjoy the lovely view of the Girgaum Chowpatty beach which is quite close to Kamala Nehru Park. 
\One can also enjoy the panoramic views of marine drive from the park particularly at sunset. 

Situated atop a hill, this park attracts beautiful birds during monsoon. 

Kamala Nehru Park is famous for a unique structure called the Old Women's shoe or Boot House, that famously is fun for kids.
5 am to 9 pm Weekdays and Weekends
No entry fee
Open throughout the year and can be visited any time.

Jijamata Udyan formerly called as "Ranichi Bagh" after the orignal British name Victoria Gardens, and now also known as Veermata Jijabai Bhonsle Udyan,is a zoo and garden located at Byculla, in the heart of Mumbai, India. 

Jijamata udyan is full of lush green trees and famous for the species of birds and animals easily seen once you enter Jijamata udyan. 

With the green trees is a botanical garden in the pathway inside the zoo flower plants, herb plants and other new species of plants.
One can visit the different gardens inside the zoo like zoo botanical garden, Tactile garden, Medicinal Garden. \n\nPeople can see various animalsa around them.
9 am to 6 pm Thursday to Tuesday \n Closed on Wednesday
5 Rupees for Adults. \n2 Rupees for Children.
The park is open throughout the year and can be visited anyime except on wednesdays.

The park enthralls its visitors with its mesmerizing fauna and flora 

The presence of 2400 year old Kanheri caves carved out from rock cliffs,in its premises is another added attraction of this place. 

The gorgeous sight of the lakes, rivers,valleys and hills provide an in-depth theraputic effect on body and mind.

Every visitor who comes here enjoys the great panorama of the lush greenery with a ramarkable collection of birds,butterflies and various kinds of fauna including the wild leopard. 

One would find a varied collection of wild animals including Bonnet and Rhesus monkeys, Indian Hare, Sambar deer, Gray Lungur, Chital, Macaque and many more. 

Another major attractions of this place is presence of Atlas Moth, world's largest moth.Karvi an exotic variety of flora is also found here which blossoms only once in eight years. 

Authorities of the park also arranged tiger and lion safari which attracts about 2 million tourists every year. 

The thich cover of the dense forest is home to different types of plants and trees including khair, kusum ,teak, bamboo and many others.
7 am to 6.30 pm Tuesday to Sunday \nClosed on Monday

Entry Fees 
33 Rupees per Adult. 

Boat rides 
Boating timings 9.30 am to 5.30 pm 
33 Rupees per person for 2 seater boat. 
66 Rupees per person for 4 seater boat. 

Lion and Tiger Safari 
Safari timings 9 am to 12.30 pm 
and 2 pm to 4.30 pm 
55 Rupees for Adult. 
22 Rupees for Child. 

Kanheri Caves 
Kanheri caves timings 9 am to 5 pm 
Rupees 5 for Adult.
The National park can be visited any time of the year.
